title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 43.10 - Electrical wiring and components
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 43.10 - Electrical wiring and components

State Regulations

Electrical wiring in or about a machine shall be of good
quality and shall be properly installed. Insulation shall be resistant to
moisture and of such quality and dimensions as to prevent short circuits. All
electrical components shall be designed and constructed to function safely
under the voltage imposed and to be protected from interference by unauthorized
persons. Fuse boxes shall be locked if accessible to the public. No voltage
shall be imposed greater than the maximum for which the components were
designed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
43.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
